channel.title: Posts on Ryan A. Gibson
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Ryan A. Gibson

item.title: Leaderboard of Open LLMs Ranked by LLM Judges
item.description: An evaluation of recent consumer-grade open LLMs based on ratings generated through an LLM-as-a-judge framework.

item.title: How to Run LLMs Larger than RAM
item.description: A short experiment on running larger LLMs on low-end consumer hardware, with comments on performance trade-offs and practicality.

item.title: How Risky is a Correlated Hedge?
item.description: A brief analysis of how much risk you can reduce by hedging with correlated assets. Even in a perfect world, a 90% correlation limits risk reduction to about 50%.

item.title: A Tale of T-Mobile Prepaid Billing Errors
item.description: A discussion of an odd bug in T-Mobile’s systems, resolved only after filing an FCC complaint. This post details my experience, the support timeline, and some theories on the mysterious charges.

item.title: Why the Hell Is This Git Repo So Large? And How to Trim It Down
item.description: A guide on reducing the size of an oversized Git repository, using the Blowfish Hugo theme as a case study. Learn best practices for maintaining a lean repo and its history.

item.title: Analyzing Political Party Strength vs. Quality of Life in U.S. States
item.description: A data-driven exploration of how political lean correlates with quality of life metrics across the United States.

item.title: Modeling Optimal PC Building Decisions
item.description: What is the optimal amount to spend on a computer? How often should its components be upgraded? We review historical data and build a plausible model of computer performance over time.

item.title: On the Time Burden of Office Work
item.description: How much of a pay cut is in-office work compared to remote? All else being equal, maybe a bit more than you’d expect.

item.title: Deriving Analytic Retirement Estimates: A DIY Approach
item.description: Take a DIY approach to calculating rough retirement timelines. No need for fancy services – roll your own, either for a secondary sanity check or out of curiosity!

item.title: Analytic Early Retirement Calculator
item.description: A retirement calculator that estimates your retirement timeline, required annual savings, and assesses your progress toward retirement goals.

item.title: Animated Cellular Automaton QR Codes
item.description: An experiment in using randomized cellular automata to generate QR codes that remain valid on every frame.

item.title: The Importance of Saving Early for Retirement
item.description: A 22-year-old college graduate that saves $300/month will have more in retirement than a worker who starts saving $1,100/month at 40 years old. Let’s talk about it.

item.title: Absurd Password Lengths and the Computational Limits of Humanity
item.description: A discussion of password strength, brute-force attacks, and the physical limits of the universe.

item.title: Tips on Creating the Smallest Possible QR Codes
item.description: Some brief tips and discussion on how to make tiny QR codes with a focus on web URLs.

item.title: Steganography: Hiding Data Inside Data
item.description: A general introduction to hiding information in plain sight, its uses in the real-world, and how it works in digital mediums.
